segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 3
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 3

segments.pli: 6. Brāhmaṇavagga
segments.en: 6. Brahmins

segments.pli: 59. Jāṇussoṇisutta
segments.en: 59. With Jāṇussoṇi

segments.pli: Atha kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ … pe … ekamantaṃ nisinno kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then the brahmin Jāṇussoṇi went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him. Seated to one side he said to the Buddha:

segments.pli: “yassassu, bho gotama, yañño vā saddhaṃ vā thālipāko vā deyyadhammaṃ vā, tevijjesu brāhmaṇesu dānaṃ dadeyyā”ti.
segments.en: “Master Gotama, whoever has a sacrifice, an offering of food for ancestors, a dish of milk-rice prepared for an auspicious ceremony, or a gift to give, should give it to the brahmins who have mastered the three Vedic knowledges.”

segments.pli: “Yathā kathaṃ pana, brāhmaṇa, brāhmaṇā tevijjaṃ paññapentī”ti?
segments.en: “But brahmin, how do the brahmins describe a brahmin who is proficient in the three Vedic knowledges?”

segments.pli: “Idha kho, bho gotama, brāhmaṇo ubhato sujāto hoti mātito ca pitito ca saṃsuddhagahaṇiko yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā akkhitto anupakkuṭṭho jātivādena, ajjhāyako mantadharo, tiṇṇaṃ vedānaṃ pāragū sanighaṇḍukeṭubhānaṃ sākkharappabhedānaṃ itihāsapañcamānaṃ, padako, veyyākaraṇo, lokāyatamahāpurisalakkhaṇesu anavayoti.
segments.en: “Master Gotama, it’s when a brahmin is well born on both his mother’s and father’s side, of pure descent, irrefutable and impeccable in questions of ancestry back to the seventh paternal generation. He recites and remembers the hymns, and has mastered the three Vedas, together with their vocabularies, ritual, phonology and etymology, and the testament as fifth. He knows philology and grammar, and is well versed in cosmology and the marks of a great man.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā tevijjaṃ paññapentī”ti.
segments.en: That’s how the brahmins describe a brahmin who is proficient in the three Vedic knowledges.”

segments.pli: “Aññathā kho, brāhmaṇa, brāhmaṇā brāhmaṇaṃ tevijjaṃ paññapenti, aññathā ca pana ariyassa vinaye tevijjo hotī”ti.
segments.en: “Brahmin, a master of three knowledges according to the brahmins is quite different from a master of the three knowledges in the training of the noble one.”

segments.pli: “Yathā kathaṃ pana, bho gotama, ariyassa vinaye tevijjo hoti?
segments.en: “But Master Gotama, how is one a master of the three knowledges in the training of the noble one?

segments.pli: Sādhu me bhavaṃ gotamo tathā dhammaṃ desetu yathā ariyassa vinaye tevijjo hotī”ti.
segments.en: Master Gotama, please teach me this.”

segments.pli: “Tena hi, brāhmaṇa, suṇāhi, sādhukaṃ manasi karohi; bhāsissāmī”ti.
segments.en: “Well then, brahmin, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bho”ti kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo bhagavato paccassosi.
segments.en: “Yes sir,” Jāṇussoṇi replied.

segments.pli: Bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: The Buddha said this:

segments.pli: “Idha pana, brāhmaṇa, bhikkhu vivicceva kāmehi … pe …
segments.en: “Brahmin, it’s when a mendicant, quite secluded from sensual pleasures …

segments.pli: catutthaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
segments.en: enters and remains in the fourth absorption.

segments.pli: So evaṃ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇāya cittaṃ abhininnāmeti.
segments.en: When their mind has become immersed in samādhi like this—purified, bright, flawless, rid of corruptions, pliable, workable, steady, and imperturbable—they extend it toward recollection of past lives.

segments.pli: So anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussarati, seyyathidaṃ—ekampi jātiṃ dvepi jātiyo … pe … iti sākāraṃ sauddesaṃ anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussarati.
segments.en: They recollect many kinds of past lives, with features and details.

segments.pli: Ayamassa paṭhamā vijjā adhigatā hoti;
segments.en: This is the first knowledge that they attain.

segments.pli: avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā; tamo vihato, āloko uppanno yathā taṃ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
segments.en: Ignorance is destroyed and knowledge has arisen; darkness is destroyed and light has arisen, as happens for a meditator who is diligent, keen, and resolute.

segments.pli: So evaṃ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte sattānaṃ cutūpapātañāṇāya cittaṃ abhininnāmeti.
segments.en: When their mind has become immersed in samādhi like this—purified, bright, flawless, rid of corruptions, pliable, workable, steady, and imperturbable—they extend it toward knowledge of the death and rebirth of sentient beings.

segments.pli: So dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena … pe … yathākammūpage satte pajānāti.
segments.en: With clairvoyance that is purified and surpasses the human, they understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds.

segments.pli: Ayamassa dutiyā vijjā adhigatā hoti;
segments.en: This is the second knowledge that they attain.

segments.pli: avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā; tamo vihato, āloko uppanno yathā taṃ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
segments.en: Ignorance is destroyed and knowledge has arisen; darkness is destroyed and light has arisen, as happens for a meditator who is diligent, keen, and resolute.

segments.pli: So evaṃ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte āsavānaṃ khayañāṇāya cittaṃ abhininnāmeti.
segments.en: When their mind has become immersed in samādhi like this—purified, bright, flawless, rid of corruptions, pliable, workable, steady, and imperturbable—they extend it toward knowledge of the ending of defilements.

segments.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti;
segments.en: They truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.

segments.pli: ‘ime āsavā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti … pe … ‘ayaṃ āsavanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
segments.en: They truly understand: ‘These are defilements’ … ‘This is the origin of defilements’ … ‘This is the cessation of defilements’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of defilements’.

segments.pli: Tassa evaṃ jānato evaṃ passato kāmāsavāpi cittaṃ vimuccati, bhavāsavāpi cittaṃ vimuccati, avijjāsavāpi cittaṃ vimuccati;
segments.en: Knowing and seeing like this, their mind is freed from the defilements of sensuality, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.

segments.pli: vimuttasmiṃ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṃ hoti.
segments.en: When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.

segments.pli: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānāti.
segments.en: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’

segments.pli: Ayamassa tatiyā vijjā adhigatā hoti;
segments.en: This is the third knowledge that they attain.

segments.pli: avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā; tamo vihato, āloko uppanno yathā taṃ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharatoti.
segments.en: Ignorance is destroyed and knowledge has arisen; darkness is destroyed, and light has arisen, as happens for a meditator who is diligent, keen, and resolute.

segments.pli: Yo sīlabbatasampanno,
segments.en: One who is perfect in precepts and observances,

segments.pli: pahitatto samāhito;
segments.en: resolute and serene,

segments.pli: Cittaṃ yassa vasībhūtaṃ,
segments.en: whose mind is mastered,

segments.pli: ekaggaṃ susamāhitaṃ.
segments.en: unified, serene;

segments.pli: Pubbenivāsaṃ yo vedī,
segments.en: who knows their past lives,

segments.pli: saggāpāyañca passati;
segments.en: and sees heaven and places of loss,

segments.pli: Atho jātikkhayaṃ patto,
segments.en: and has attained the end of rebirth,

segments.pli: abhiññāvosito muni.
segments.en: that sage has perfect insight.

segments.pli: Etāhi tīhi vijjāhi,
segments.en: Because of these three knowledges

segments.pli: tevijjo hoti brāhmaṇo;
segments.en: a brahmin is a master of the three knowledges.

segments.pli: Tamahaṃ vadāmi tevijjaṃ,
segments.en: That’s who I call a three-knowledge master,

segments.pli: nāññaṃ lapitalāpananti.
segments.en: and not the other one, the lip-reciter.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, ariyassa vinaye tevijjo hotī”ti.
segments.en: This, brahmin, is a master of the three knowledges in the training of the noble one.”

segments.pli: “Aññathā, bho gotama, brāhmaṇānaṃ tevijjo, aññathā ca pana ariyassa vinaye tevijjo hoti.
segments.en: “Master Gotama, the master of three knowledges according to the brahmins is quite different from a master of the three knowledges in the training of the noble one.

segments.pli: Imassa ca, bho gotama, ariyassa vinaye tevijjassa brāhmaṇānaṃ tevijjo kalaṃ nāgghati soḷasiṃ.
segments.en: And, Master Gotama, a master of three knowledges according to the brahmins is not worth a sixteenth part of a master of the three knowledges in the training of the noble one.

segments.pli: Abhikkantaṃ, bho gotama … pe …
segments.en: Excellent, Master Gotama! Excellent! …

segments.pli: upāsakaṃ maṃ bhavaṃ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan”ti.
segments.en: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

segments.pli: Navamaṃ.

sections.title: Then the brahmin Jāṇussoṇi went up to the Buddha,…

suttaplex.blurb: A master of Vedic knowledge in the brahmanical system and in the Buddha’s.
